info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 4:15PM EDT until April 7 at 8:03AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Big Raccoon Creek near Fincastle.
Big Walnut Creek near Reelsville.
White Lick Creek at Mooresville.
Mill Creek near Cataract.
Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
Big Blue River at Carthage.
Youngs Creek at Amity.
Sugar Creek near Edinburgh.
Fall Creek at Millersville.
Wildcat Creek near Jerome.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
Haw Creek near Clifford.
Buck Creek at Acton.
Sugar Creek at New Palestine.
Driftwood River near Edinburgh.
Clifty Creek at Hartsville.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Big Blue River at Carthage.
* WHEN...Until Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Extensive flooding is in progress. Many local roads flood and are impassable to most vehicles. A few evacuations are necessary in southern parts of Carthage, extreme southern sections of Knightstown, eastern Raysville and a few rural areas of northwest Rush County. Used auto parts yard in Carthage is flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 PM EDT Saturday was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.5 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1045 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Henry, IN; Rush, IN; Shelby, IN
